qas.question: When was the Federal Republic of Germany created

plausible_answers.text: under American, British, and French administration

context: The creation of <b9_0>the <b11_0>Federal Republic<b9_0/> of Germany<b11_0/> <b4_0>in <a0_0>1949<b4_0/><a0_0/> was through the unification of the western states (which were previously <b7_0>under <a1_0>American, <b10_0>British<b10_0/>, and French<a1_0/> administration<b7_0/>) created in the aftermath of <a3_0><b5_0><b13_0>World War II<b13_0/><b5_0/><a3_0/>. Initially, in 1949, the states of the Federal Republic were Baden, Bavaria (in German: Bayern), Bremen, Hamburg, Hesse (Hessen), Lower Saxony (Niedersachsen), North Rhine Westphalia (Nordrhein-Westfalen), Rhineland-Palatinate (Rheinland-Pfalz), Schleswig-Holstein, Württemberg-Baden, and Württemberg-Hohenzollern. <a2_0><b6_0><b8_0><b12_0>West Berlin<b12_0/><b8_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, while officially not part of the Federal Republic, was largely integrated and considered as a de facto state.
